sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_21
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews now. I'm Tecumseh Sulaka with your top stories this hour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_21
sentences.sentence: Unfair and ineffective, the head of the United Nations slams COVID-19 travel bans, saying they won't stop the spread of the Omicron variant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_21
sentences.sentence: The Women's Tennis Association suspends all tournaments in China over concerns about the safety of double-star Peng Shuai.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_21

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_21
sentences.sentence: And conservative justices on the U.S. Supreme Court signal they're ready to uphold a 15-week ban on abortion, potentially undermining the nationwide right to termination.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The United States has become one of the latest nations to confirm a case of the COVID-19 Omicron variant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It's been detected in California in someone who had recently returned from South Africa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_20
sentences.sentence: The individual is self-quarantining and all close contacts have been contacted and all close contacts thus far have tested negative.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_20
sentences.sentence: The individual was fully vaccinated and experienced mild symptoms which are improving at this point.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: At least 23 other countries have reported Omicron infections since South African authorities first identified the variant a week ago. It's an announcement that has led the US and many other nations to almost bar all airline travelers arriving from southern Africa. It's a move heavily criticized by the UN's chief. With a virus that is truly borderless, travel restrictions that isolate any one country or region are not only deeply unfair and punitive, they are ineffective.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Spain is one country tightening travel restrictions, but it still wants tourists to come.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Visitors from the United Kingdom who are not EU residents will only be able to enter Spain if they're fully vaccinated. It will no longer be sufficient to have a negative PCR test or to have had the disease.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: I think it's good.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: I think it's, yeah, good measures to stop people coming in without having been vaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: It's as simple as that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Costa Blanca business owners can only hope the impact on tourists will be minimal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: EU chief Ursula von der Leyen has called for discussions on making COVID-19 jabs mandatory in the face of the reluctance by some people to be vaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Unexpectedly high case surges has led many member nations to renew steps to curb infections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It is understandable and appropriate to lead this discussion now, how we can encourage and potentially think about mandatory vaccination within the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But it is a discussion that I think has to be led.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Austria has officially extended its lockdown and was the first EU country to order mandatory vaccinations. Germany's incoming chancellor Olaf Scholz is also in favor of mandatory COVID-19 jabs for all Germans. New infections have soared in recent weeks, particularly in the east and south, with hospitals there already transferring intensive care patients to other parts of Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Vaccine producers like Moderna say mass vaccination programs are one of the best ways of fighting new coronavirus variants. It's now the time to get vaccinated. You know, this variant seems to be concerning as you know I hear from WHO, I hear from scientists around the planet. Now it's the last moment and today it's probably the only weapon or in the therapeutic arsenal that we have is vaccination. So my recommendation is get boosted, get vaccinated to ensure that your immunity is as high as possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile the WHO has said that vaccines remain the best way to combat the coronavirus pandemic along with wearing masks and maintaining social distancing rules.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian officials have asked NATO to prepare a sanctions package against Russia in an effort to deter Moscow from launching an invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: NATO foreign ministers met for a second day in the Latvian capital Riga, where talks have been dominated by Russia's military build-up on its border with Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Seven years ago, Russia seized Crimea and then later annexed the territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The United States is particularly concerned about troop movements on the border and what Russia could be planning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: So despite uncertainty about intentions and timing, we must prepare for all contingencies while working to see to it that Russia reverses course.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's limited what NATO can actually put on the table. At the moment, obviously, all sides, NATO itself, Ukraine and Russia are aware that there is no real option of any military involvement from the NATO side. So what we're really talking about is economic sanctions, perhaps some political sanctions as well, but fundamentally it will be economic measures that would hopefully restrain Russia and cause them to think twice. We've had the US Secretary of State talking about measures that have not previously been considered. Some have speculated this may mean removal or restriction of Russia's access to things like the international SWIFT banking system, which would have a major impact on the Russian economy. The question is whether these economic factors will be enough to deter Russia from something that many believe is a fundamental foreign policy priority for President Putin, which is to reassert Russian authority over Ukraine. Secretary Blinken and 56 other foreign ministers

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Our reporter Per Bergfors Nyberg has the latest from Stockholm.

sentences.sentence: Sweden's foreign minister, Anne Linde, is hosting the ministerial council of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe the OAC here in Stockholm Linda who's the chairperson in office has invited the 56 other foreign ministers of the OSCE including Russian foreign minister Sergei Lavrov and the US Secretary of State Antony Blinken.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: This annual two-day summit will be an opportunity to rebuild trust and to find common ground, Linda says, and to respond to the multiple challenges, crises and conflicts in the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: High on the agenda will of course be the tensions between Russia and Ukraine, the migrant crisis on the border between Poland and Belarus, and the unresolved Nagorno-Karabakh conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08

The organization has warned the recovery from last year's post-pandemic slump is running out of steam. The increase in consumer demand has led to bottlenecks in global supply chains. This is pushing up prices, creating inflation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In 2022, the world's major economies are forecast to grow, but generally between 1 to 4 percent less than in 2021. Japan is the exception, with growth next year expected to increase to 3.4%.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The organisation expects global growth to hit 5.6% this year, dropping to 4.5% in 2022.

As regions in Spain impose new restrictions to tackle the COVID-19 wave, the tourism and hospitality sector fears another disappointing Christmas season and the new Omicron variant may only make things worse. Bars and restaurants in Madrid are fully booked ahead of the thousands of festive gatherings that are typical in Spain before Christmas. Hospitality business owners warn they won't be able to stay afloat if they are further restrictions after a devastating season last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: In the United States, a Supreme Court hearing is once again sparking furious debate over abortion rights.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_21
sentences.sentence: The body's conservative majority have signalled they could be willing to accept new restrictions. Thomas Blade has the story.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Demonstrators on both sides of the abortion argument gather outside the US Supreme Court.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In the biggest challenge to abortion rights in decades, a number of conservative justices signalled their support for curbing abortion access.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The judges are being asked to consider whether the state of Mississippi can ban abortion at 15 weeks gestation, roughly nine weeks before bans are permitted under current law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Their decision could threaten the 1973 landmark Roe v Wade ruling that guaranteed the constitutional right to abortion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I'm hoping that in this case the justices choose life they choose to uphold the Mississippi law and I hope that we see this if not a full overturning of Roe v Wade at least returning some of that power back to the states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I love people who have had abortions and I really am just here to support them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I've never had an abortion myself, but there is a chance that I might need one one day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: And this is just about abortion justice and liberating abortion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The case comes before the Supreme Court, which now, after three nominations under the Trump administration, has a 6-3 conservative majority.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The ruling is expected in June, four months before next year's Congressional elections and could become a campaign season rallying cry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Euronews reporter Ray Suarez is in Washington DC and was listening to the hearing on Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: He says whatever the outcome of the case, America's bitter debate over abortion is far from over.

sentences.sentence: The argument wrapped up just a few minutes ago.

sentences.sentence: Who gets to decide whether a woman must carry a pregnancy to term or whether she is free to end that pregnancy if she so chooses? Intense argument, questions from the justices of the Supreme Court, two lawyers on the various sides. What's at stake? If the Mississippi law is upheld by the justices of the Supreme Court, it will leave states likely free to go their own way on abortion, to no longer be controlled by the precedents set by the Roe v. Wade decision in the early 1970s. This has been a titanic 50-year battle over the right to abortion in the United States.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: Instead of coming to an end, it will just open up a new front in that seemingly endless political war. But you're likely, if the Mississippi law stands, to end with a country where on one side of a state border, a woman may terminate her pregnancy, but on the other side of that border, maybe a 10 minute drive away, it might be, strictly speaking, illegal under almost any circumstances.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Actor Alec Baldwin has denied pulling the trigger of the gun that accidentally killed a cinematographer on his film set in October.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In his first recorded interview, Baldwin disputes reports that until now alleged he pointed the gun and fired it, thinking it contained blanks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Police are still investigating the circumstances of how the gun went off when Baldwin removed it from its holster.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: An armed gang has rammed several vehicles into a prison in central Mexico and escaped with nine inmates in a dramatic breakout.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In the pre-dawn attack, the gang burst into the prison after first torching two cars outside as a distraction. State police have launched a search operation to try and recover the prisoners. Two officers were injured in the raid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: French researchers may have found a way to fight overfishing, with a smart net that can

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: help sort fish even before they are brought on board.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The device that is still under review is equipped with cameras and sensors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It is able to film the fish in the nets and identify them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The potentially revolutionary system is currently being tested in the open sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Here we can see, for example, in blue all the horse mackerel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: They are caught on screen using artificial intelligence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: In pink we can see all the sardines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Fishermen can be informed about their catches in real time and activate escape devices in the trawler.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Globally every year, 20 million tonnes of fish, that's around 25 per cent of total catches, are discarded at sea. That's according to the UN Food and Agriculture Agency. This wastage varies depending on the species being fished.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: I'm not interested in having the fish on the deck and sorting them once they're dead. I prefer to sort them once they're at the bottom in the water. That's why this project is interesting because we'll know at all times what's going into the net." The researchers are also developing other smart fishing aids like a net with openings that can allow non-target fish to be released. There's also this bottom trawl that lifts to avoid damaging the seabed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: These new fishing technologies are expected to be expensive when they hit the market.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: It may mean that they are unaffordable to many fishermen in France who already say finances are tight due to the dispute with the United Kingdom over access to fishing zones.
